Loop over each year from 2019 to 2023 and read the corresponding water-quality CSV file.
Filter the data to keep only records whose 'Beach Name' contains the word 'Wollaston', using na=False so missing names do not raise errors.
Transform the 'Violation' column to lowercase and flag rows equal to 'yes' to identify tests that exceeded swimming-quality standards.
For each year compute the exceedance rate as (# of violations) ÷ (total Wollaston records); if a year has no records, set the rate to 0 to avoid division by zero.
Store the yearly rates, take their mean, and calculate 1 − mean_rate to obtain the overall fraction of time the beach met standards across 2019–2023.
Convert that fraction to a percentage (integer format when printed) and display the result.
